p.s: The sonnet Sonnet 65 written by William Shakespeare consists of three quartrainsquatrains and one final couplet.
The rhyme scheme is ABAB CDCD EFEF GG.
The rhyme scheme shows that the rhyme of the sonnet is a cross rhyme.
The metre of the sonnet is the iambic pentameter.
Therefore there are 10 syllables each verse.
The first syllable is unstressed and the second syllable stressed.
That is how it goes on in every verse of the sonnet.
The Sonnet 65 deals with the overall theme of love.
In particular the deals with hard times of love and the passing of time.
It is said that nothing can destroy the power of love except mortality which means that every day in liflife counts.
There is so much anger in the world people are concentrating on that they often do not see the good things around them.
Often the good thing cannot come up against the bad things we concentrate on.
With the time passing by it seems that all of the those important things are unimportant.
Because people miss what time has given to them they cannot do anything about it to get their time back.
But when the author writes about it he catches time and shows his love which should be the most important thing in life.
